Package com.shortcuts.table

Class TablePrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shortcuts.table.TablePrinter
  • public class TablePrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    TablePrinter is used to print out a Table instance via a type of files: .md or .txt Using this class you can save and store your table output to a different types of file.
    See Also:
    Table

      • printToFile

        public boolean printToFile​(java.io.File file)
        Method for printing out an output of Table object to a .txt file.
        Parameters:
        file - specified file for storing table output
        Returns:
        boolean true if file was successfully written, and false elsewhere

      • printToFile

        public boolean printToFile​(java.io.File file,
                           boolean append)
        An override version of printToFIle method for printing out an output of Table object to a .txt file. Boolean append parameter is used to overwrite a file with a new table output if its false, and true if you want to add new table output to a previous one.
        Parameters:
        file - specified file for storing table output
        append - is a switcher, if append is true, then table will be printed to a file with old records, and if append is false, then the method overwrites a filewith a new table output.
        Returns:
        boolean true if file was successfully written, and false elsewhere

      • printToMarkdownFile

        public boolean printToMarkdownFile​(java.io.File mdFile)
        Method for printing out an output of Table object to a .md file.
        Parameters:
        mdFile - specified .md file for storing table output
        Returns:
        boolean true if file was successfully written, and false elsewhere

      • printToMarkdownFile

        public boolean printToMarkdownFile​(java.io.File mdFile,
                                   boolean append)
        An override version of printToFIle method for printing out an output of Table object to a .md file. Boolean append parameter is used to overwrite a mdFile with a new table output if its false, and true if you want to add new table output to a previous one.
        Parameters:
        mdFile - specified .md file for storing table output
        append - is a switcher, if append is true, then table will be printed to a mdFile with old records, and if append is false, then the method overwrites a mdFilewith a new table output.
        Returns:
        boolean true if mdFile was successfully written, and false elsewhere
